issues.description: Method name mismatch between the problem statement and the code: the problem text and UML refer to a static method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal) (used in multiple places), but both the template's commented Main and the solution implement and call a method named computeMealCost(Meal). This is a structural inconsistency in the expected API (name/signature) and can confuse students about which method to implement and which name the tests expect.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method name consistent across all artifacts. Either (A) update the problem statement (UML/text) to refer to computeMealCost(Meal) everywhere, or (B) rename the solution (and any template references) to calculateTotalPrice(Meal). Ensure the public static signature matches exactly the name used in the tests and examples.

issues.description: Contradictory instructions about how/where the shared stock should be initialized: the problem text first instructs that both attributes (orders and stock) should be initialized in the SealSaloon constructor, but immediately afterwards requires the stock attribute to be static (shared across instances). Initializing a static shared field in an instance constructor is misleading and contradicts the later explicit requirement that stock be static and shared. This creates confusion about whether stock is an instance or class-level attribute and where students should initialize it.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the intended design: if stock is meant to be shared across all SealSaloon instances, explicitly state that stock is static/final and should be initialized at declaration or in a static initializer (not in the instance constructor). Update the sentence that says 'These should be initialized ... in the constructor' to refer only to the instance attribute orders; explicitly instruct students that the static stock should be declared static final and may be initialized at declaration or in a static block.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) refers to a SealSaloon method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal) but the template/solution code use the name computeMealCost(Meal). This mismatch means students reading the problem will look for calculateTotalPrice but find computeMealCost in the provided code (and in Main), creating an unnecessary mapping burden between the requirement and the implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the naming consistent. Either rename the method computeMealCost(Meal) in SealSaloon (and update all call sites such as Main) to calculateTotalPrice(Meal) to match the problem statement/UML, or update the problem statement/UML to refer to computeMealCost(Meal). Prefer renaming the code method to calculateTotalPrice to align with the exercise description.
